Detailed Description

Err.

Common abort with message function for programs to call.

static void Err::check ( bool  passed,
const char *  msg 
) [inline, static]

errAbort based version of assert with an error message.

Try to use this method in conjunction with a const char * message (rather than constructing a string every time) when writing a check that will be called lots of times.

Parameters:
passed - Condition to be checked.
msg - Error message if failed.

void Err::setExitOnError ( bool  val  )  [static]

Toggle whether to set the value returned when exiting on errors This is primarily used to suppress Windows OS handling of return values indicating an exe did not terminate successfully.

if val is true, the value in setExitOnErrorValue will be returned.

void Err::setThrowStatus ( bool  doThrow  )  [static]

Give the current error handler a hint about whether or not to throw exceptions.

Note that this is just a hint and that if a specifical behavior is really required it is best to push a custom error handler onto the stack.

Parameters:
doThrow - if true requesting exceptions to be thrown, if false not to be thrown
